data.title: Silent film of The Overcoat by Nikolay Gogol
data.meta_description: Silent film of Gogol's The Overcoat shot in Petrograd in 1926. Explore the historic streets of St.Â Petersburg's in The Overcoat by Kozintsev and Trauberg.
data.text: A classic of early Soviet cinema, this 1926 film by the FEKS experimental film studio, directed by Grigory Kozintsev and Leonid Trauberg, is based on "The Overcoat", one of the most celebrated of Nikolay Gogol's Petersburg Tales. The tragicomic tale of the government clerk Akakiy Akakievich and his ill-fated overcoat unfolds on the snowy streets of Leningrad in winter, providing unique historic footage of the city in the post-Revolutionary period.
